result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashtin R Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Assessment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; maintain full time work or school or a combination of the two.  If not fully engaged, 10 hours of community service per week.
No contact with Pic N Save on Bridge Street.  Payment of restitution of $890 to Pic N Save to be paid at $80 per month, letter of apology to victim, DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashtin R Stevens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Becky.
Case called: 3:12 pm
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, pro se;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW; Victim Impact statement filed;

State moves to 
Ct 2 Retail Theft-Intentionally Take)>D&RI
COURT GRANTS

PLEA: 
Ct 1 (Theft-Business Setting)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain FTW/School, or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged 10 hrs CS per week; No Contact with Pic-N-Save on Bridge St; Restitution of $890 to Pic-N-Save to be paid at $80 per month; Letter of Apology to victim; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

Adj: 3:19 pm

Plea hearing at 03-07-2016 02:40 pm.
Final pre-trial at 04-14-2016 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 05-03-2016 09:00 am.

No contact with Pick N Save Wausau-Bridge Street. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
